name: D. Lucky Chains
statement:
Let’s name a pair of positive integers (x, y) if the greatest common
divisor of them is equal to 1 (
gcd(x, y) = 1).Let’s define a induced by (x, y) as a sequence of pairs
(x, y), (x + 1, y + 1), (x + 2, y + 2),
dots, (x + k, y + k) for some integer k
ge 0. The of the chain is the number of pairs it consists of, or (k +
1).Let’s name such chain if all pairs in the chain are lucky.You are
given n pairs (x_i, y_i). Calculate for each pair the length of the
longest lucky chain induced by this pair. Note that if (x_i, y_i) is not
lucky itself, the chain will have the length 0.
